news_header: Finnish arms exports reached EUR 333 million last year, with military products accounting for EUR 192 million and civilian weapons for $141 million.
news_text: According to SaferGlobe's arms control report, Finland's arms exports totaled EUR 333 million last year, which is more than double the amount reported in 2002. Of this total, EUR 192 million were military products, while civilian weapons exports amounted to $141 million, with over half directed towards the United States, Canada, and Australia. SaferGlobe, a Finnish think tank established in 2010, focuses on promoting sustainable peace and security.
